intro: Olotrema gynobasis, commonly known as the African moonflower, is a climbing plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Asclepiadaceae and is characterized by its large, showy white flowers that bloom at night. The plant has a distinctive milky sap and produces a unique type of fruit known as a follicle. Its leaves are alternate and often have a hairy texture, while its stems are woody and can grow quite long. Olotrema gynobasis is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is also used in traditional medicine.
